paper_abstract: We investigate the decoding region for algebraic soft-decision decoding (ASD) of Reed-Solomon (RS) codes in a discrete, memoryless, additive-noise channel. An expression is derived for the error correction radius within which the soft-decision decoder produces a list that contains the transmitted codeword. The error radius for ASD is shown to be larger than that of Guruswami-Sudan (GS) hard-decision decoding for a subset of low and medium-rate codes. These results are also extended to multivariable interpolation in the sense of Parvaresh and Vardy.
paper_title: Performance Analysis of Algebraic Soft-Decision Decoding of Reed-Solomon Codes
